citation.article-title: Balneatrix alpica gen. nov., sp. nov., a bacterium associated with pneumonia and meningitis in a spa therapy center.

p.s: Description of Balneatrix alpica sp. nov.
Balneatrix alpica (al'pi.ca, L. fem. adj., pertaining to the Alps)
Gram-negative, straight or curved rods, 0.5 to 0.7 μm by 2.8 to 5 μm.
Strictly aerobic.
On tryptic soy agar, colonies are convex and smooth, 2 to 3 mm in diameter after 2-day incubation at 30°C.
The centre of the colony is pale yellow after 2-3 days and pale brown after 4 or 5 days.
No factors are required for growth and the temperature range is 20 to 46°C.
Salt tolerance is lower than 1% NaCl (w/w).
Oxidase positive, arginine "dihydrolase" positive, lysine and ornithine decarboxylase negative.
Indole is produced in "urée-indole" medium or peptone water after 1 to 2 days.
Nitrate reduced to nitrite, tributyrin hydrolysed, egg yolk reaction (lecithinase) positive, "rglutamyl transferase test positive.
Urea not hydrolysed.
Tetrathionate not reduced.
Starch, o-nitrophenyl-β-D-galactopyranoside, hydroxyquinoline-β-glucuronide, p-nitrophenyl-β-xyloside not hydrolysed.

The following substrates are utilized in minimal medium (MT0-0.15 % agar) in Biotype-100 strips after 2 or 4 days of incubation: N-acetylglucosamine, cis-aconitate, L-alanine, DL-γ-amino-n-butyrate, Dl-δ-amino-n-valerate, Laspartate, betaine, D-fructose, fumarate, D-gluconate, D-glucose, L-glutamate, glutarate, glycerol, DL-β-hydroxybutyrate, myo-inositol, α-ketoglutarate, L-malate, maltose, maltotriose, D-mannitol, D-mannose, L-proline, propionate, putrescine, D-ribose, L-serine, D-sorbitol, succinate and L-tyrosine.

The following substrates are not utilized in 6 days: trans-aconitate, adonitol, D-arabinose, D-arabitol, L-arabitol, benzoate, caprate, caprylate, D-cellobiose, m-coumarate, dulcitol, i-erythritol, esculin, L-fucose, D-galactose, D-galacturonate, gentisate, β-gentiobiose, D-glucuronate, DL-glycerate, histamine, m-hydroxybenzoate, p-hydroxybenzoate, itaconate, 2-keto-D-gluconate, 5-keto-D-gluconate, lactose, lactulose, D-lyxose, malonate, maltitol, Dmelezitose, D-melibiose, 1-O-methyl-α-galactopyranoside, 1-O-methyl-β-galactopyranoside, 3-O-methyl-D-glucopyranose, L-Omethyl-β-D-glucopyranoside, 1-O-methyl-β-D-glucopyranoside, mucate, palatinose, phenylacetate, 3-phenylpropionate, protocatechuate, (-) quinate, D-raffinose, L-rhamnose, D-saccharate, saccharose, L-sorbose, D(-)tartrate, L(+)tartrate, meso-tartrate, D-tagatose, Dtrehalose, tricarballytate, trigonelline, tryptamine, L-tryptophan, D-turanose, xylitol, D-xylose.
The G + C content of the DNA is 54 mol%.
The habitat is probably fresh water.
Occasional human pathogen.
The type strain is strain 4-87 ( = CIP 103589).
Description of the type strain
Strain 4-87 has all the properties given for the species.
In addition, it hydrolyses Tween-80.
Isolated from human cerebrospinal fluid.
